content.description: Good route that involves stemming and mantles most of the way up. This route is still cleaning up but provides some of the best climbing on this wall.
Scramble up and right to the first bolt. Pull a strenuous move or two with slippery feet, mantle and continue up the bolt line.
content.location: Route is located on far right side. Climb and belay from underneath the first bolt. Rap from the bolts above.

climbs.name: Snot Slot
climbs.fa: FA: (TR)  Kelly Vaught, Frank Bentwood  FA:  (Lead)  T.G. Sierra Zacks, Zachary Kinsey, Matthew Navarro, Christian Groff, Alec Groff, Dan Zacks

content.description: This is the furthest left route on the wall.  Scramble up a low angle apron with a left-arching crack to a steep water chute.  Climb into the water chute then up the chute to a bolted anchor.
content.protection: Four bolts to a bolted anchor.
content.location: left side of Oregon Trail Wall.

content.description: Crux is underneath the 4th bolt and requires some tense stemming. Good route on decent rock.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor rap
content.location: Route lies just right of a crack that goes up the middle of this face. Scramble up and to the right to get to the first bolt. Depending on where your belay is located you may need to down climb from the initial ledge. Watch your rope length on this route.

content.description: Scramble up to a ledge to get to the first bolt. Choose your holds wisely as you make some insecure smears on this fairly chossy face.
content.location: Scramble up and left to a ledge to get to the first bolt. Follow four more bolts to a two bolt anchor rap. Depending on where your belay is located you may need to down climb from the initial ledge. Watch your rope length on this route.

content.description: Start up easy slab and crack to gain the big ledge.  Step into the shallow rounded corner and follow its crack up as the scalloped slot narrows, to reach a long vertical flange (fun feature!) along the left edge of crack.  Easier climbing above leads up to bolted rap anchor just right of the crack.  Rap with one 60 m rope leaves about 5 ft to spare on each strand.
content.location: The obvious crack system with a long vertical flange, between Tucker Dies of Dysentery and Secret Mormon Underwear.

content.description: Crux is in finding the better quality holds. Decent and sustained climbing ensue once the holds are discovered.
content.protection: TR from the anchor of Tai Kwon Bro
content.location: Gully just right of Tai Kwon Bro
